name: $admitting
desc: A diagnosis made on the basis of medical signs and patient-reported symptoms, rather than diagnostic tests.

name: $clinical
desc: One of a set of the possible diagnoses that could be connected to the signs, symptoms, and lab findings.

name: $differential
desc: The diagnosis given when the patient is discharged from the hospital.

name: $discharge
desc: A diagnosis based significantly on laboratory reports or test results, rather than the physical examination of the patient.

name: $laboratory
desc: A diagnosis which identifies people's responses to situations in their lives, such as a readiness to change or a willingness to accept assistance.

name: $nursing
desc: A diagnosis determined prior to birth.

name: $prenatal
desc: The single medical diagnosis that is most relevant to the patient's chief complaint or need for treatment.

name: $principal
desc: A diagnosis based primarily on the results from medical imaging studies.

name: $radiology
desc: A diagnosis determined using telemedicine techniques.

name: $remote
desc: The labeling of an illness in a specific historical event using modern knowledge, methods and disease classifications.

name: $retrospective
desc: A diagnosis determined by the patient.
